recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Methi Malai Matar is a combination of green peas and fresh fenugreek leaves cooked with indian spices and fresh cream. The creamy texture goes exceptionally well with roti, parathas, chapati.
The thickness of the gravy comes from the nuts used like cashews and ground nuts which is later grinded to form a ground paste along with other spices.
his dish is very famous in north india. Fenugreek is a good source of Calcium, Iron and Phosphorus.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Wash fenugreek leaves well with water, finely chop and keep it aside. Wash peas well and keep it aside.

To make ground paste, in a pan / wok, heat oil. Add onions, fry till its slightly brown. Add green chillies, garlic and ginger, sauté for 1 minute. Add tomatoes. Fry till completely cooked. Ad turmeric powder and coriander powder. Fry for 1 minute. Keep it aside for it to cool. In the same pan, without adding additional oil, fry the cashew or ground nuts for a minute or two to remove the raw smell. Grind the above mixture along with nuts to form a smooth paste. add water if required.

In the same pan, add 1 tbsp oil. Add cumin seeds, let it splutter. Add curry leaves. After 5 seconds, add Methi /  Fenugreek leaves. Sauté for 2 minutes. Then add green peas and fry for 2 minutes. Add the ground paste, fresh cream, mix it well. Cook on medium flame for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.

Reduce the flame, add milk, cover and simmer for 8 minutes. Keep stirring in between to prevent burning. Add garam masala and salt, mix it well. Cook it for 1 minute and switch off the stove. Enjoy hot with rotis \ chapatis \ phulkas.

tips.tipDesc: If you don't have fresh methi, use frozen one. To enhanced taste, use ghee instead of oil.
